articles.summary: Nirmala Sitharaman chaired a pre-Budget meeting in New Delhi with States and Union Territories ahead of the 2026–27 Union Budget, set for February 1, marking her ninth presentation.

articles.title: Lenders sanction ₹3,362 cr under Credit Guarantee Scheme for Exporters in a month
articles.summary: Lenders sanctioned ₹3,361.83 crore to 774 applicants under the ₹20,000-crore CGSE, aiding exporters hit by US tariffs. PSBs posted record profits and improved GNPA and capital ratios.

articles.title: Lloyds Engineering enters purchase agreement with US-based The Material Works
articles.summary: Lloyds Engineering Works signed a global deal with The Material Works for EPS Gen 4, allowing acid-free steel cleaning and EPS cell sales worldwide.

articles.title: Protests in Iran near 2-week mark as authorities intensify crackdown on demonstrators
Jhansi’s first female auto driver murder: UP police arrest main accused after brief encounter
articles.summary: On January 4, Anita Chaudhary was shot dead near Sakunwa Dhukwan Colony in the Nawabad police station area.

articles.title: IndiaOne Air RCS flight involved in incident near Rourkela, all on board safe
articles.summary: The aircraft was forced to land at a location near Jalda, approximately 15–20 kilometres short of the airport. The crew declared a MAYDAY to Rourkela Air Traffic Control prior to the forced landing, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said.

articles.title: Delhi-NCR residential launches jump 39% in Q4 2025 on infrastructure push: Cushman & Wakefield
articles.summary: Delhi-NCR saw a 39 percent rise in new housing launches in Q4 2025, led by Gurugram, Noida and Ghaziabad, driven by infrastructure upgrades like Dwarka Expressway and steady buyer demand.

articles.title: RTE admissions rules in UP: Government issues fresh guidelines to private schools for 2026–27
articles.summary: The district-wise annual targets for admission will be determined up to 25% of the total capacity of the lowest entry class (Class 1 or pre-primary) of all unaided private schools.

articles.title: Civic polls: BJP suspends 58 functionaries in Mumbai, Nagpur for dissent, indiscipline
articles.summary: BJP suspended 58 leaders from Mumbai and Nagpur for six years over indiscipline before January 15 municipal polls, including Divya Dhole, Nehal Amar Shah, and Vinayak Dehankar.

articles.title: Spandana Sphoorty evaluates merger of subsidiary Criss Financial
articles.summary: Spandana Sphoorty Financial is evaluating the merger of Criss Financial Ltd into itself, with a Merger Steering Committee formed to assess and finalise the transaction terms.

articles.title: Civic polls: 100 concrete roads, 300-bed hospital among key promises of BJP for Mira Bhayandar
articles.summary: BJP promises 100 new roads, a 300-bed civil hospital, pollution control, and Metro projects for Mira Bhayandar ahead of MBMC polls, with Devendra Fadnavis and Ravindra Chavan leading the campaign.

articles.title: ISRO's Aditya-L1 decodes how solar storms impact Earth's magnetic field
articles.summary: ISRO’s Aditya-L1 revealed how a 2024 solar storm compressed Earth’s magnetic field, exposing satellites and intensifying auroral currents, stressing the need for real-time space weather monitoring.

articles.title: Rajasthan roadways bus collides with pickup vehicle near Kotputli, several injured
Apple shares on pace to match longest losing streak since 1991
articles.summary: The iPhone maker fell as much as 1.1% on Friday, putting the stock on track for an eighth-straight losing session.

articles.title: Homebuyers' 'fraud': ED attaches land parcels worth ₹585 crore in Haryana, UP
articles.summary: The Enforcement Directorate on Saturday said it has attached hundreds of acres of land in Haryana and Uttar Pradesh worth more than Rs 580 crore in a money laundering case against a DelhiNCRbased real estate company which allegedly duped numerous homebuyers.

articles.title: Justice Soumen Sen sworn-in as Kerala HC Chief Justice
articles.summary: Justice Soumen Sen sworn in as the 40th Chief Justice of Kerala High Court, replacing Justice Nitin Jamdar. Ceremony attended by Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar and Pinarayi Vijayan.

articles.title: More held in Turkman Gate stone-pelting incident; arrests continue
articles.summary: Delhi Police arrested 16 people in the Turkman Gate stone-pelting case. Influencers like Aimen Rizvi and Salman are under probe. A Samajwadi Party MP's role is also being examined.

articles.title: Shed colonial mindset, trust Indian capability: Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw to railway officials
articles.summary: Addressing senior officials at the Ati Vishisht Rail Seva Puraskar ceremony, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw laid out a reform-driven roadmap for Indian Railways, emphasising technology adoption, safety, advanced training and wider collaboration with startups to position the national transporter as a global benchmark by 2047.

articles.title: India confident of dealing with headwinds from ‘known, unknown sources’: Principal Secy to PM Shaktikanta Das
articles.summary: Principal Secretary to the PM Shaktikanta Das highlights India's resilience amid global shocks, outlining challenges and strategies for Viksit Bharat and continued economic growth.

articles.title: Government plans changes to National Highways Act to fast-track road projects
articles.summary: The government is considering amendments to the National Highways Act to ease land acquisition, cut litigation and speed up highway construction, with proposals likely to be tabled in Parliament’s Budget Session.

articles.title: CBIC flags fake GST notices, advises taxpayers to verify DIN
articles.summary: The CBIC on Friday flagged fake GST notices being sent to businesses and asked taxpayers to report such frauds immediately.

articles.title: US adds fewer jobs than expected in December, unemployment rate declines
articles.summary: US job growth cooled sharply in December, with weak hiring, downward revisions and mixed labour signals, even as falling unemployment and strong consumption kept the broader economic outlook resilient.

articles.title: India cuts US Treasury holdings by 21% in 2025, signals reserve diversification
articles.summary: India’s US Treasury holdings fell 21% to $190.7 billion dollars in 2025, reflecting a strategic shift toward gold and non-dollar assets amid global uncertainty.

articles.title: UBS explains why the rupee’s troubles may not be over yet
articles.summary: UBS’s Rohit Arora expects the rupee to remain under pressure, pegging dollar-rupee at 94 for the year due to weak capital flows, current account concerns and a recovering US dollar. He said any trade deal-led support may be temporary, with limited upside for the rupee. UBS remains more positive on the Chinese renminbi among Asian currencies.

articles.title: India’s consumption recovery: When Goldman Sachs expects demand to pick up
articles.summary: Santanu Sengupta, Chief India Economist at Goldman Sachs, said urban credit growth has already started to recover, helped by regulatory easing from the RBI..

articles.title: Why India’s credit system needs accountability in distribution
articles.summary: Loans represent some of the largest and longest tenure financial decisions made by households and MSMEs, yet those intermediating these decisions face no market wide requirements for training, testing or continuing education, notes Shachindra Nath, Founder & Managing Director, UGRO Capital.

articles.title: US Supreme court likely to rule on Trump tariffs today; What is at stake here?
articles.summary: While it is not guaranteed that the Supreme Court will issue its verdict, it has designated Friday as a “decision day” for releasing opinions, and many anticipate that the tariff case will be addressed.

articles.title: Global cooperation showing resilience despite geopolitical headwinds: WEF study
articles.summary: The barometer indicated that the overall level of cooperation has largely been unchanged in recent years, but the composition of cooperation appears to be evolving.

articles.title: Most of Wall Street drifts as defence companies rocket higher
articles.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 109 points, or 0.2 per cent, as of 9:35 am Eastern time, and the Nasdaq composite was 0.4 per cent lower.

articles.title: GDP to grow by 7.5 pc in FY26, says SBI report
articles.summary: The First Advance Estimates released by the National Statistics Office (NSO) on Wednesday put GDP growth in 2025-26 at 7.4 per cent as compared to 6.5 per cent in the previous fiscal. The RBI has projected the growth rate at 7.3 per cent.

articles.title: Sanctions rhetoric vs market reality: Why oil prices may stay soft and Indian refiners could still gain
articles.summary: As Washington sharpens its sanctions language on Russian oil, analysts caution that structural oversupply, rising global inventories and pragmatic enforcement limits are likely to keep crude prices under pressure. For India, the evolving mix of discounted Russian barrels and softer heavy crude markets could translate into steadier feedstock costs and improved refining margins, even as geopolitical risks persist.

articles.title: Budget 2026: EY pitches TDS simplification for ease of doing business, seeks consolidation
articles.summary: EY has urged the government to simplify the tax deducted at source framework by sharply reducing the number of rates and eliminating low-rate TDS on GST-covered transactions, arguing that the current system creates avoidable compliance burdens without adding meaningful oversight.

articles.title: RBI data shows credit card spends growing, but pace moderates after festive season
articles.summary: India’s credit card spending remained in double digits in November despite post-festive moderation, driven by rising card penetration and strong e-commerce demand, while per-card spends eased and public sector banks gained market share, RBI data shows.

articles.title: US employment anomaly, not geopolitics, clouds 2026 global outlook: JPMorgan’s Aziz
articles.summary: Jahangir Aziz, Head of Emerging Markets Economic Research at JPMorgan, warned that without a revival in private capital expenditure, India’s growth will remain dependent on cyclical, government-led stimulus rather than shifting to a sustainable, higher growth trajectory.

articles.title: Substantial rise in wealth of Indian-origin adults in UK over past decade: Study
articles.summary: Median wealth rose "substantially" for Indian-origin adults in the UK even as the wealth gap between ethnic groups in the country widened significantly over the past decade, new research by the London School of Economics (LSE) has revealed.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP estimates hold up as economists assess what lies beneath
articles.summary: India’s FY26 GDP growth estimate of 7.4% reassures economists, but softer nominal expansion, fiscal maths and base effects explain why the headline number only tells part of the story.

articles.title: GDP growth to slip to 6.8% in FY27, limited scope for rate cuts: Report
articles.summary: A report by Goldman Sachs further said inflation is likely to firm up, leaving limited scope for the Reserve Bank to cut rates further.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP at 7.4% looks strong, but economists caution on soft nominal growth
articles.summary: India’s FY26 real GDP growth of 7.4% meets expectations, but economists warn that weaker nominal growth could weigh on earnings, fiscal math and market sentiment despite headline resilience.

articles.title: India’s 'Goldilocks' run to continue for next two years; FY27 growth likely at 6.5-7%: EAC-PM Chair
articles.summary: 'India has entered into FTAs with various trade partners which is contributing to diversification of exports. This adds to the overall resilience of exports,' the EAC-PM Chairman said.

articles.title: Budget 2026–27: PHDCCI calls for easier credit, lower compliance costs for MSMEs
articles.summary: Interest subvention, higher MUDRA limits and tax audit exemption for micro units among key asks

articles.title: India FY26 GDP first advance estimates see real growth at 7.4%, nominal GDP misses poll
articles.summary: In the first formal step towards framing the Union Budget, India’s FY26 GDP advance estimates peg real growth at 7.4%, driven by services, while nominal growth is seen at 8%.

articles.title: Govt signals capex push ahead of Budget with new three-year PPP pipeline
articles.summary: Ahead of the Union Budget, the Centre has unveiled a three-year PPP pipeline worth ₹17 lakh crore, signalling a renewed capex push and efforts to crowd in private investment across core infrastructure sectors.

articles.title: Budget flexibility hinges on nominal growth this year, economists caution
articles.summary: Low nominal GDP growth could complicate India’s Budget arithmetic despite strong real growth, with Morgan Stanley’s Upasana Chachra and HDFC Bank’s Sakshi Gupta outlining implications for fiscal deficit, spending and FY27 assumptions.

articles.title: India’s capex revival: Manufacturing, new-age sectors lead as services, infra lag
articles.summary: Economists Teresa John of Nirmal Bang and Sameer Narang of ICICI Bank analyse India's evolving capital expenditure landscape. While private capex is reviving, it's driven by new sectors like renewables, electronics, and data centres, contrasting with previous cycles. Metals are expected to remain a dominant theme, while the government is likely to maintain its spending at 3% of GDP, with a potential focus on railways and defence in the upcoming budget.

articles.title: Quick commerce’s next hurdle is gig worker security, say industry executives
articles.summary: India’s quick commerce boom faces a social security challenge as gig work scales rapidly, with TeamLease CFO Ramani Dathi and Updater Services COO Saravanan CR highlighting the trade-offs between worker benefits, platform costs, and flexibility.

articles.title: Japan's service sector growth slows in December, PMI shows
articles.summary: The S P Global final Japan Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 51.6 in December from 53.2 in November, worse than a flash reading of 52.5 but remaining above the 50.0 line that separates growth from contraction for the ninth consecutive month.

articles.title: CCI probe finds Tata Steel, JSW Steel, SAIL colluded on steel prices: Reuters report
articles.summary: India’s competition watchdog has found Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SAIL breached antitrust law by colluding on steel prices, a Reuters exclusive reported on Tuesday, exposing firms and executives to potential penalties.

articles.title: India’s FY26 real GDP growth seen at 7.5%, nominal at 8.3%: CNBC-TV18 poll
articles.summary: Ahead of Budget 2026, a CNBC-TV18 poll expects FY26 real GDP growth at 7.5% and nominal GDP growth at 8.3%.

articles.title: This one banking ratio is flashing a warning, but not a crisis
articles.summary: India’s loan-to-deposit ratio has hit a record 81.6%, signalling strong credit demand but rising liquidity stress for banks as loan growth outpaces deposits, raising concerns over margins, future lending capacity and policy transmission.

articles.title: Rate cuts may revive real estate stocks in 2026: Bernstein’s Venugopal Garre
articles.summary: Venugopal Garre, Managing Director and Head of India Research at Bernstein, said the macroeconomic environment remains stable and the economy is not collapsing, but warned that growth momentum is fading and upside potential is limited. Bernstein projects an 8% upside for the Nifty, with a target of 28,100.

articles.title: Rice exporters seek budget sops, interest subvention to boost competitiveness
articles.summary: Indian Rice Exporters asked Nirmala Sitharaman for tax breaks, interest aid, and freight support in Budget 2026 to boost exports and sector growth.

articles.title: India services PMI slips to 11-month low in December as demand and hiring weaken
articles.summary: The HSBC India Services Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI), compiled by S P Global, slipped to 58.0 in December from 59.8 in November. The latest reading also came in below the flash estimate of 59.1. A PMI reading above 50 indicates expansion, while a print below that threshold signals contraction.

articles.title: Payments Regulatory Board: RBI charts vision for 2028 in first meeting
articles.summary: Members discussed the draft Payments Vision 2028, providing strategic guidance to further develop India’s fast-growing digital payment ecosystem where transaction volumes are projected to nearly triple by FY30.

articles.title: RBI to take over Delhi government’s banking operations, manage public debt
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India will assume responsibility for the Delhi government’s banking operations and rupee public debt from January 9, 2026.

articles.title: UAE probe urges DGCA to tighten regulatory oversight after Air India Express tail-strike incident
articles.summary: The UAE investigation has pointed to gaps in crew coordination, energy management and landing procedures, calling for stronger regulatory supervision and enhanced pilot training to prevent recurrence of tail-strike incidents during critical landing phases.

articles.title: Manappuram Finance denies report on delay in Bain deal, says RBI approval pending
articles.summary: Manappuram Finance said its Bain Capital–linked transaction is on track, with RBI approvals for management changes received and final approval pending; shares dropped 5.33% to ₹293 on the BSE.

articles.title: Phoenix Mills Q3 Update: Retail consumption up 20%, office occupancy at 77%
articles.summary: Phoenix Mills reported 20% YoY growth in Q3 FY26 retail consumption to ₹4,787 crore, improved office occupancy to 77% with 1.20 msft leased in 9M FY26, steady hospitality performance with RevPAR growth at The St. Regis Mumbai, and higher residential sales of ₹140 crore in the quarter.

articles.title: Top Stories | Markets' worst week in four months, MF inflows ease, mixed US jobs data & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: RailTel to establish greenfield data centre in Addis Ababa for Ethiopian govt
articles.summary: RailTel Corporation of India Ltd will establish a greenfield data centre for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ethiopia in Addis Ababa, a company's press note said on Friday.

articles.title: Globus Spirits Q3 PAT jumps multifold at ₹30.44 crore
articles.summary: Revenue from operations in the quarter under review stood at Rs 938.36 crore as against ₹882.96 crore in the year-ago period, it added.

articles.title: Practical beauty brand Antinorm raises ₹28 crore in seed round, CEO expects 5-10x growth
articles.summary: Backed by Fireside Ventures, Antinorm is betting on multifunctional, climate-focused beauty products to address the needs of time-starved urban women, as the young brand scales its portfolio, deepens customer engagement and sharpens its direct-to-consumer play.

articles.title: Nippon Paint India appoints Sharad Malhotra as new Managing Director
articles.summary: Under the new leadership, Nippon Paint India will consolidate all its paints and coating businesses under a unified operating model.

articles.title: Embassy Developments Q3 Update | Pre-sales jump 240% QoQ to ₹1,392 crore
articles.summary: Embassy Developments recorded ₹1,392 crore in Q3FY26 pre-sales, up 240% QoQ, with collections at ₹415 crore; received RERA approvals for four projects with GDV over ₹12,800 crore and net institutional debt stood at ₹2,939 crore.

articles.title: Akasa Air joins IATA after completing safety audit
articles.summary: Akasa Air joins IATA after IOSA audit, marking a milestone since its 2022 launch. It operates 31 Boeing 737 MAX and serves 32 destinations.

articles.title: Ashiana Housing Q3 sales rise sequentially, nine-month performance trails FY25
articles.summary: Lower project launches weighed on Ashiana Housing Ltd's year-on-year numbers despite quarter-on-quarter improvement in bookings and sales.

articles.title: ITC Hotels secures ₹327-crore lease in Delhi's Dwarka for 5-star hotel project
articles.summary: ITC Hotels has secured leasehold land at Yashobhoomi, Dwarka, New Delhi from the India International Convention and Exhibition Centre Limited for a lease premium of ₹326.5 crore and a lease period of about 91 years, to develop and operate a premium 5-star hotel with banqueting and signature cuisine offerings, strengthening its presence in the Delhi NCR hospitality market.

articles.title: PayNearby introduces dual-authentication system for SHG cash transactions
articles.summary: PayNearby launches dual-authentication digital cash services for Self-Help Groups via Digital Naari, aiming to benefit one crore members and boost financial inclusion for women in rural areas.

articles.title: BCCL sees workforce at 22,000 by 2030, wage hikes of 15–20% ahead
articles.summary: Coal India’s Director of Finance Mukesh Agrawal said Bharat Coking Coal is targeting a net profit of around ₹2,900 crore by 2030, which would translate into an EBITDA of over ₹5,000 crore.

articles.title: Skydo receives RBI’s final approval to operate as cross-border payment aggregator
articles.summary: Skydo receives RBI approval as Payment Aggregator–Cross Border, serving 30000 exporters in 50 cities, supporting 32 currencies, and expanding services after raising 20 million dollars in funding.

articles.title: IGL clears pre-qualification stage for Saudi Arabia gas distribution tender
articles.summary: IGL added that the competition documents for the next stage of the tender will be shared by the Saudi authorities in due course.

articles.title: Vodafone's AGR relief, US Supreme Court on Trump tariffs, Trump on China and Taiwan, Q3 results and more
articles.summary: In today's newsletter, we take a look at Vodafone's timeline on AGR, the US Supreme Court's call on Trump's pivotal tariff regime, Q3 results today, IREDA results, Power Mech's major order win worth over ₹3,126 crore and more. Here is all you need to know with CNBC-TV18's Newsletter

articles.title: Chevron, Vitol, Trafigura vie to control Venezuelan oil exports
articles.summary: Chevron, Vitol, Trafigura and others vie for U.S. deals to export Venezuelan crude as Washington seeks indefinite control after capturing President Nicolas Maduro, reshaping global oil dynamics.

articles.title: China's Anta Sports offers to buy Pinault family's 29% Puma stake: report
articles.summary: Artemis had been expecting any offer for its Puma stake to exceed 40 euros a share, a fourth person with knowledge of the matter told Reuters. All four sources spoke on condition of anonymity because the matter is private.

articles.title: From stigma to scale: How Antara is building India’s senior-care ecosystem
articles.summary: As attitudes towards ageing shift in post-pandemic India, Antara Senior Care is carving out a multi-vertical elder-care platform spanning senior living, care homes and health products. In a conversation with CNBC-TV18, Executive Chairperson Tara Singh Vachani outlines how rising longevity, changing family structures and a growing focus on wellness are driving demand—while regulatory gaps and lack of standards remain the sector’s biggest scaling challenge.

articles.title: Power Mech Projects secures ₹3,126 crore battery storage orders from WBSEDCL
articles.summary: Power Mech’s subsidiary PM Green has secured a ₹3,126 crore order from WBSEDCL to set up a 250 MW / 1,000 MWh Battery Energy Storage System at Goaltore, West Bengal, under a Build-Own-Operate model, with an additional 250 MW/1,000 MWh greenshoe option at Durgapur.

articles.title: Singapore Motorshow 2026 highlights electric ambition, luxury craftsmanship and performance innovation
articles.summary: Singapore Motorshow 2026 featured Suzuki e VITARA, MINI Nürburgring, Mercedes CLA, Porsche Cayenne Electric, Maybach SL 680, and AVATR 11.

articles.title: NHPC board approves plan to issue up to ₹2,000 crore unsecured bonds via private placement
articles.summary: NHPC’s board approved the proposal to issue up to ₹2,000 crore of unsecured, redeemable, taxable, non-convertible, non-cumulative AH-Series bonds through private placement as part of its FY26 borrowing plan.

articles.title: Sleeper coach buses to be manufactured by automobile cos, govt-accredited facilities: Gadkari
articles.summary: Existing sleeper coach buses will have to be retrofitted with fire detection systems, emergency exits with hammers, emergency lighting, and driver drowsiness indicators, he adds

articles.title: Retail holding in HDFC Bank drops to lowest level in 20 quarters
articles.summary: Retail investors are trimming HDFC Bank holdings as mutual funds, FPIs, and HNIs increase stakes, while high loan-to-deposit ratio and declining stock weigh on sentiment.

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal raises ₹273 crore from anchor investors, allocates 11.88 crore shares
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal, a wholly owned subsidiary of Coal India, has raised ₹273.1 crore from anchor investors by allocating 11.88 crore equity shares at ₹23 per share ahead of its IPO opening on January 9, with 7.17 crore shares allotted to three domestic mutual funds through eight schemes.

articles.title: US control of Venezuelan oil threatens China’s Belt and Road loans, Caribbean caught in great power crossfire
articles.summary: The US intervention in Venezuela is reverberating beyond Latin America, threatening the stability of China’s Belt and Road loans and placing Caribbean nations in a delicate balancing act. While China’s immediate energy supply may remain largely intact, the long-term strategic and financial stakes are high, forcing regional players to navigate an increasingly fraught geopolitical landscape.

articles.title: Hindustan Unilever gets ₹1,560-crore income tax order for FY22
articles.summary: Hindustan Unilever has received an income tax assessment order with a demand of ₹1,559.69 crore for FY2021-22 related to transfer pricing and corporate tax adjustments, with the company stating there is no material financial or operational impact and that it will file an appeal within the stipulated timeline.

articles.title: Slightly more Americans file for jobless benefits in last week of 2025, but layoffs remain low
articles.summary: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims for the week ending January 3 rose by 8,000 to 2,08,000, up from 2,00,000 the previous week, the Labour Department reported Thursday.

articles.title: Bharat Electronics secures new orders worth ₹596 crore
articles.summary: Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) has secured additional orders worth ₹596 crore, including drone detection and jamming systems, mobile communication terminals, software solutions, upgrades, spares, and services, strengthening its defence electronics portfolio.

articles.title: UpGrad-Unacademy acquisition talks collapse over valuation differences: Report
articles.summary: The deal discussions broke down after both sides failed to agree on valuation expectations and the proposed structure, as per Moneycontrol.

articles.title: Power Grid wins project to boost renewable energy transmission in Karnataka
articles.summary: Power Grid Corporation has been declared the successful bidder under tariff-based competitive bidding to establish a 400 kV inter-state transmission system on a BOOT basis, strengthening the network to integrate 3GW of additional renewable energy at Davanagere (0.25 GW) and Bellary (2.75 GW) in Karnataka.

articles.title: Bharat Forge, Germany's Agile Robots sign MoU for AI-driven industrial automation
articles.summary: Bharat Forge and Germany-based Agile Robots have signed an MoU to explore a strategic collaboration in AI-driven robotics and intelligent industrial automation, focusing on co-developing bespoke manufacturing, logistics and CPG solutions for operations in India and Southeast Asia.

articles.title: From SEZ to DTA framework: A taxman clarifies the law interpreted by the Supreme Court
articles.summary: The Apex Court’s decision needs a careful study by the authorities concerned to ensure that in future there is no gap between intention and law; if the intention is to charge duty on such DTA clearances than it must be done under the charging section and not the exemption route, notes Najib Shah, former chairman, Central Board of Indirect Taxes & Customs.

articles.title: RVNL strengthens order book with ₹201-crore railway workshop project
articles.summary: Rail Vikas Nigam Limited received a ₹201.23 crore contract from East Coast Railway to set up a wagon POH workshop at Kantabanji, Odisha, with a capacity of 200 wagons in 18 months.

articles.title: Zoho founder asked to post $1.7 billion bond in divorce asset dispute, US Court’s 2025 order shows
articles.summary: A US court ordered Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu to post a $1.7 billion bond in his divorce case with Pramila Srinivasan, citing concerns over asset transfers and fair division of marital property.

articles.title: Prestige Estates signs agreement to buy 16.38-acre land parcel in Chennai
articles.summary: Prestige Estates, through its JV Canopy Living LLP, has signed an agreement to purchase a 16.381-acre land parcel in Padi, Chennai, near Anna Nagar, aligning with its strategy to strengthen presence in prime urban locations and support future residential and mixed-use development. Shares of Prestige Estates Projects Ltd ended at ₹1,583.80, down by ₹35.70, or 2.20%, on the BSE.

articles.title: Air India takes delivery of first Dreamliner after privatisation
articles.summary: Air India receives its first custom-made Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner since Tata Group takeover, marking a major fleet upgrade and expansion for the airline.

articles.title: ICICI Lombard says draft Q3 financials were accidentally shared on WhatsApp; internal inquiry underway
articles.summary: ICICI Lombard probes accidental WhatsApp leak of unaudited Q3 results, reports to stock exchanges and starts internal inquiry.

articles.title: Financial Intelligence Unit tightens AML, cybersecurity norms for virtual digital asset firms
articles.summary: FIU-IND tightens rules for virtual digital asset firms in India, mandating CERT-In audits, FIU registration, stronger KYC, and board-level oversight to boost AML and CFT compliance.

articles.title: Demat account additions slow to six-year low in 2025 despite all-time high base
articles.summary: India’s demat accounts hit 21.59 crore in December 2025, but growth slowed to 16.5%, with CDSL and NSDL showing the slowest expansion in six years, Livemint reported.

articles.title: ICICI Prudential Life business update: Retail premiums rise over 11% YoY in December
articles.summary: ICICI Prudential Life saw December 2025 RWRP up 11.5% and new business premiums rise 25.1%, with mixed nine-month growth. Update filed with BSE, NSE under SEBI LODR.

articles.title: Vedanta gets NCLT nod for demerger scheme with Talwandi Sabo Power
articles.summary: Vedanta Limited received NCLT Mumbai approval to restructure subsidiaries like TSPL, Vedanta Aluminium Metal Limited, and others, aiming for focused management and improved efficiency.

articles.title: Moody's upgrades Shriram Finance outlook to positive, affirms Ba1 rating
articles.summary: Moody's revised Shriram Finance Limited's outlook to positive after MUFG Bank's plan to acquire a 20% stake, boosting capital, funding diversity, and profitability by 2026.

articles.title: Newsbreak confirmed: Lemon Tree Hotels announces reorganisation; Warburg Pincus to invest ₹960 cr in Fleur Hotels
articles.summary: Lemon Tree Hotels reorganises, with Warburg Pincus investing up to ₹960 crore in Fleur Hotels and acquiring APG’s 41.09% stake. Fleur to be listed separately in 12-15 months.

articles.title: Tejas Networks posts ₹196 crore loss in Q3 FY26
articles.summary: The company had posted a profit of ₹165.67 crore a year ago. Its consolidated revenue from operations plunged by about 88% to ₹306.79 crore during the reported quarter from about ₹2,642 crore in the December 2024 quarter.

articles.title: PTC Industries arm wins Blue Origin order for BE-4 engine castings
articles.summary: PTC Industries’ arm Aerolloy Technologies won a Blue Origin order for New Glenn BE-4 engine castings. The company’s share price closed lower on the NSE at ₹17,550, falling ₹17 or 0.10%.

articles.title: Akzo Nobel India appoints Shantanu Khosla as independent director; Parth Jindal named chairman
articles.summary: Board re-designates Rajiv Rajgopal as Joint MD & CEO; changes subject to shareholder approval.

articles.title: NTPC, Mahagenco sign shareholder agreement for Sinnar Thermal Power acquisition
articles.summary: NTPC Ltd and Mahagenco will jointly acquire Sinnar Thermal Power Ltd (STPL) for ₹3,800.14 crore, boosting NTPC Group’s installed capacity to 86,987 MW after NCLT approval. STPL is undergoing a corporate insolvency resolution process under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016.

articles.title: Bank of Baroda maintains overnight MCLR at 7.80% from January 12
articles.summary: Bank of Baroda keeps MCLR rates mostly unchanged from January 12. Bank of Baroda’s share price closed at ₹300.50 on the NSE on January 9, up ₹0.95, or 0.32%.

articles.title: SEBI eases technical glitch framework for stock brokers
articles.summary: SEBI eases norms for stock brokers, exempting smaller brokers and rationalising penalties for technical glitches. New rules apply only to brokers with over 10000 clients, effective immediately.

articles.title: Texmaco Rail wins two orders worth ₹126 crore
articles.summary: IVC Logistics has placed an order worth ₹62.21 crore for rakes of ACT1 wagons along with BVCM Design-C wagons. Shares of Texmaco settled at ₹126.45 apiece which is 1.94% lower than the day's opening on BSE.

articles.title: Avenue Supermarts Q3 earnings preview: Growth slows, margins under pressure; D-Mart Ready in focus
articles.summary: Avenue Supermarts’ Q3 results are expected to reflect slower sales growth and margin pressure, with investors watching same-store trends and the contribution of D-Mart Ready closely.

articles.title: Mahindra & Mahindra December sales, production see robust growth; exports decline
articles.summary: Mahindra & Mahindra saw December sales and production rise sharply year-on-year, exports fell, and the auto major unveiled electric XUV 3XO variants amid strong EV demand. The company's shares closed down 1.21%.

articles.title: Aurobindo biologics arm CuraTeQ secures Health Canada nod for Dyrupeg
articles.summary: CuraTeQ Biologics, a subsidiary of Aurobindo Pharma, received Health Canada’s Notice of Compliance for Dyrupeg, marking a major regulatory milestone for its biologics portfolio.

articles.title: Sources say banks may soon begin loan process for Vodafone Idea: Which lenders have highest exposure
articles.summary: Banks may soon assess a new ₹25,000 crore loan for Vodafone Idea Ltd after AGR relief, pending DoT committee decision. SBI leads with ₹6,279.80 crore exposure, followed by major banks.

articles.title: TCS Q3 preview: Flattish revenue, steady margins expected as AI monetisation takes spotlight
articles.summary: Tata Consultancy Services Q3FY26 results announcement on January 12 is expected to show stable growth, AI-led revenue at 5%, $6.5 billion India AI investment, and focus on margins, deal wins, and capital allocation.

articles.title: India’s diamond market to double by decade-end despite global turbulence: De Beers CEO
articles.summary: Al Cook, CEO of the De Beers Group, said the company is doubling down on India as part of its long-term strategy, driven by the country’s 2,000-year history with diamond jewellery and its strong economic growth outlook.

articles.title: Markets snap two-week winning streak, log worst week in four months
articles.summary: Indian equities snapped a two-week winning streak, posting their biggest weekly fall in four months as broad-based selling dragged benchmarks lower and erased over ₹15 lakh crore in market capitalisation.

articles.title: Why India’s bond market is becoming an opportunity investors can no longer overlook
articles.summary: As of September 30, 2025, the bond market was valued at about $2.81 trillion, according to data from SEBI and the Clearing Corporation of India, matching equities in its role in raising capital.

articles.title: ‘The bad days for microfinance are behind us,’ says Muthoot Microfin CEO
articles.summary: Sadaf Sayeed, CEO of Muthoot MicroFin, said the company is increasingly tapping the bond market to support growth and strengthen its funding profile.

articles.title: Better earnings may not mean big returns next year: HDFC Securities
articles.summary: Varun Lohchab said HDFC Securities remains overweight on financials, including banks and NBFCs. The firm is easing its underweight on consumer staples and IT towards neutral, while staying underweight on oil & gas and cement. Exposure to metals is being reduced to neutral or slightly underweight, and consumer discretionary remains marginally underweight.

articles.title: Stock Market Crash: BSE-listed companies lose ₹15 lakh crore in worst week since September
articles.summary: All sectoral indices have reported losses for the week, led by the Nifty Energy index, which declined 5%. This has turned out to be the worst week for the index since February last year, when it had declined 7% for the week that ended on February 14.

articles.title: Motilal Oswal explains why gold and silver may stay firm in 2026
articles.summary: Motilal Oswal Financial Services reports gold and silver enter 2026 with strong support, driven by central-bank demand, currency shifts, and industrial use, making them key long-term portfolio assets.

articles.title: Godrej Properties, DLF fall up to 5% as Nifty Realty emerges the top sectoral loser
articles.summary: Realty and capital market goods stocks led sectoral losses, weighing heavily on overall sentiment.

articles.title: What cautious mutual fund investors are buying right now
articles.summary: As market sentiment cools, mutual fund investors are quietly changing their playbook. Here’s where the money is going now and why.

articles.title: HDFC Bank shares set for worst week since January 2024, shed ₹1 lakh crore in market cap

articles.title: India’s 2026 market returns may stay muted, CLSA backs consumption and real estate

He said fewer policy announcements, valuation constraints and gradual de-rating will shape markets. CLSA prefers consumption, real estate and IT, and expects crude oil prices to recover towards $70, favouring upstream energy stocks.

articles.summary: Legal voices have weighed in on the escalating confrontation between the Enforcement Directorate and the Trinamool Congress, underlining that investigations cannot be disrupted by political authority, while also pointing to concerns over the breadth and timing of ED powers under the PMLA as the matter moves to the Calcutta High Court.

articles.title: Kerala sees political shifts ahead of April polls

articles.title: ED raids I-PAC office: Mamata to lead protests as court battle set to begin
articles.summary: Addressing the controversy, Banerjee accused the ED of overreach, claiming sensitive party material had been seized during the operation.

articles.title: Will never part ways: Uddhav Thackeray on unity with Raj

articles.title: Mumbai votes on January 15 as BMC polls return after four years
articles.summary: Experts say that despite confusing alliances, voters are unlikely to be influenced by political math. Instead, campaigns are being driven by big narratives such as turning Mumbai into a global city, Hindutva, and Marathi pride.

articles.title: Centre replaced MGNREGA to provide cheap labour to corporates: CM Revanth Reddy
articles.summary: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy on Thursday claimed that the NDA government at the Centre replaced the MGNREGA with VB G RAM G to ensure availability of cheap labour for big corporates by stripping the rural poor of their right to work.

articles.title: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee obstructed raids in coal smuggling case: ED

articles.title: BMC elections: Assets of key candidates record sharp rise since 2017
articles.summary: From former Mumbai mayor and Shiv Sena (UBT) candidate Kishori Pednekar to former BJP corporator Neil Somaiya and Congress candidate Sheetal Mhatre, the assets of key candidates contesting in BMC Elections 2026 have seen an exponential growth. Read on:

articles.title: Maharashtra civic polls: MMRDA transformed from 'bank' to infrastructure powerhouse, says Fadnavis
articles.summary: ”MMRDA is not a bank; it was created to fund and build infrastructure across the entire metropolitan area,” the Chief Minister stated. Fadnavis said he and his deputy Eknath Shinde have initiated projects worth ₹4 lakh crore through the MMRDA, focusing on water schemes, roads, and an expansive metro network.

articles.title: Will continue in politics till I have people's blessings: Siddaramaiah

articles.title: PMK joins AIADMK-led NDA ahead of Tamil Nadu Assembly Elections 2026

articles.summary: Leaders from the Shinde group criticised the BJP for what they termed an “indecent alliance,” accusing it of political betrayal. BJP VP Gulabrao Karanjule Patil rejected the criticism, stating that aligning with the Shinde group allegedly involved in corruption for the past 25 years would have been inappropriate.

articles.title: Aaditya Thackeray flags wildlife risks as Maharashtra clears mining near tiger corridor

articles.title: Jharkhand joins Punjab, Karnataka in opposing Centre’s new VB-G RAM G Act
articles.summary: The Jharkhand government has hardened its stance against the Centre’s new rural employment framework, with Chief Minister Hemant Soren warning that any changes undermining wage security, work guarantees and state autonomy could worsen livelihood stress and migration in tribal and rural regions.

articles.summary: The Congress has sharpened its attack on the Centre over the handling of Manipur, with MP A Bimol Akoijam alleging that buffer zones enforced by central forces are restricting movement and deepening ethnic divisions. The remarks come amid continued security concerns and President’s rule in the violence-hit state.

articles.title: Lucknow court hears arguments in complaint challenging Rahul Gandhi’s citizenship
articles.summary: A special MP/MLA court in Lucknow is examining a complaint that questions Rahul Gandhi’s eligibility as a Lok Sabha MP, with the complainant pressing for cancellation of his election from Rae Bareli. The proceedings follow the transfer of the case from Rae Bareli to Lucknow on security grounds.

articles.title: Assam Congress protests draft voter roll, alleges irregularities after special revision
articles.summary: The publication of Assam’s integrated draft electoral roll has triggered political protests, with the Congress alleging manipulation to benefit the ruling BJP. The Election Commission has defended the process, noting that additions and deletions identified during the Special Revision will be addressed during the claims and objections period before the final roll is issued.

articles.title: Economist Amartya Sen not required to attend SIR hearing over spelling error, says EC
articles.summary: The Election Commission (EC) on Tuesday clarified that Nobel laureate Amartya Sen, who was reportedly summoned by the EC over discrepancies in the spelling of his name in the voter list, is not required to appear for a hearing, an official said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Pothole-free Mumbai by end-2026 is my promise: Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde

articles.title: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor defends Karnataka govt’s stand on Bengaluru demolition drive
articles.summary: Tharoor said notices had been issued to the residents before the demolition. He said he did not see justice in politically projecting the issue only on the basis that the affected people were poor. "The government has taken a decision to provide temporary accommodation and has promised permanent housing within five to six months,” he said.

articles.title: Thane civic polls see 649 candidates in fray after mass withdrawals
articles.summary: The final list of candidates highlights sharp contrasts across Thane’s wards, with some constituencies witnessing intense competition while others saw significant pruning due to withdrawals and invalid nominations. Election officials said the uneven spread reflects both strategic exits and stricter scrutiny of nomination papers.

articles.title: RSS not a para-military organisation, says Mohan Bhagwat
articles.summary: ”A false narrative is being built against the Sangh. Nowadays, people do not go deep to gather the right information. They do not go to the origin. They go to Wikipedia. Everything is not true out there. Those who go to reliable sources will get to know about the Sangh,” he said.

articles.title: Rajnath Singh flags 'alarming trend' of educated people indulging in anti-national activities

articles.title: CAG flags fiscal transparency gaps as Centre’s debt remains elevated
articles.summary: Audit flags fiscal transparency gaps as Centre’s debt stays above pre-pandemic levels, breaches FRBM targets, disclosure inconsistencies persist, and interest costs strain public finances economy.

Repeated electoral setbacks have reduced the Congress's leverage within Opposition alliances, while regional parties are increasingly prioritising state-specific strategies over a unified national front.

articles.summary: In a firm statement to the industry, the minister emphasized that advancements on these objectives will be monitored rigorously, noting that businesses should expect daily review calls from his office to guarantee that timelines and commitments are fulfilled.

articles.title: Neuralink plans 'high-volume' brain implant production by 2026, Musk says
articles.summary: The company began human trials of its brain implant in 2024 after addressing safety concerns raised by the US Food and Drug Administration, which had initially rejected its application in 2022.

articles.title: Grok claims safeguards tightened after users misuse AI to morph images of women, children
articles.summary: Concerns grew around a disturbing trend on X where users were asking Grok to morph photographs of women and children into sexually compromising images. The manipulated images were then shared without consent, leaving victims exposed to harassment and humiliation.

articles.title: Outlook 2026 | How the upcoming Budget can help turn India from AI testing ground to global proving ground
articles.summary: Budget 2026 could mark a turning point in India’s AI journey—by backing deployment, skilling, compute access, and multilingual datasets, India can move beyond pilots to become the world’s most important AI proving ground, notes Apurv Agrawal, Co-Founder and CEO of SquadStack.ai.

articles.title: Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Scheme: When can beneficiaries get January 2026 instalment
articles.summary: Women await the January 2026 instalment under the Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Scheme introduced by the Maharashtra government.

articles.title: 8th Pay Commission | January DA revision: How much hike central government employees can expect
articles.summary: The Ministry of Labour and Employment published November 2025 AICPI-IW at 148.2, pushing DA for central government employees to likely 60% from January 2026, pending December data.

articles.title: Donald Trump calls for one-year cap on credit card interest rates at 10%: Key points explained
articles.summary: Trump made the announcement on his social media platform Truth Social, saying that credit card companies charge excessively high rates, often ranging from 20% to 30% or more.

articles.title: Gold ETF inflows hit all-time high of ₹11,646 crore in December on safe-haven demand
articles.summary: Gold ETFs saw record net inflows of ₹11,646 crore in December, driven by macroeconomic uncertainty, rising gold prices, and strong investor demand, according to AMFI and Morningstar.

articles.title: Debt mutual funds see net outflows of ₹1.32 lakh crore in December
articles.summary: Debt-oriented mutual fund schemes saw net outflows of ₹1.32 lakh crore in December, driven by year-end cash needs of corporates, with floater funds attracting inflows amid rate cut uncertainty.

articles.title: CDSL Ventures KYC records surpass 10 crore mark
articles.summary: CDSL Ventures Limited has crossed 10 crore KYC records, highlighting its role in centralised KYC data and digital onboarding for market participants in India’s financial ecosystem.

articles.title: SIP inflows hit all-time high of ₹31,002 crore in December: AMFI
articles.summary: Monthly SIP inflows hit a record ₹31,002 crore in December, as per AMFI, despite net equity mutual fund inflows dipping to ₹28,035 crore and total AUM slightly falling to ₹80.23 lakh crore.

articles.title: Equity mutual fund inflows fall 6% in December; AUM slips to ₹80.23 lakh crore
articles.summary: Net inflows into equity mutual fund schemes fell to ₹28,035 crore in December from ₹29,894 crore in November, as per Association of Mutual Funds in India data, showing a slight moderation.

articles.title: SEBI updates SIF reporting rules: What investors should know
articles.summary: SEBI introduces new compliance rules for Specialised Investment Funds, mandating detailed reporting by AMCs and trustees to boost transparency and investor protection for retail investors.

articles.title: Gold, silver prices cool in India: Why experts see this as a pause, not a reversal
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices fell in India as US dollar strength and global cues weighed on sentiment. Silver outperformed gold, driven by supply deficits and industrial demand.

articles.title: Credit card spending rises over 11% in November: CareEdge flags key drivers
articles.summary: India’s credit card spending rose 11.5% to ₹1.89 lakh crore in November 2025, driven by deeper card penetration and digital usage, as per CareEdge Ratings, despite post-festive moderation.

articles.title: JioBlackRock MF launches low and short duration debt funds
articles.summary: JioBlackRock Mutual Fund launches Low Duration Fund and Short Duration Fund, open for subscription from January 8 to 13, targeting low and short-duration fixed income investors.

articles.title: Bandhan AMC launches Arudha Hybrid Long-Short Fund under its maiden SIF strategy
articles.summary: Bandhan AMC launches Arudha Hybrid Long-Short Fund under SIF, blending debt and market-neutral equity for stability and arbitrage. Units to be listed on NSE and BSE for investor access.

articles.title: India Post Payments Bank to roll out investment platform in partnership with Choice Wealth
articles.summary: India Post Payments Bank partners with Choice Wealth to launch a digital investment platform, offering mutual funds and robo-advisory services to over 11 crore customers nationwide.

articles.title: Home loan EMIs may fall as HDFC Bank cuts MCLR by up to 5 bps

articles.title: UIDAI launches ‘Udai’: How the Aadhaar mascot will help users access services
articles.summary: UIDAI launched Aadhaar mascot Udai to simplify Aadhaar services. Arun Gokul won mascot design, Riya Jain won naming. Neelkanth Mishra unveiled Udai in Thiruvananthapuram.

articles.title: Zerodha offers IPO lock-in tracking on Kite: How investors can use the feature
articles.summary: Nithin Kamath of Zerodha urges retail investors to track IPO lock-in periods, warning of stock price drops when large shareholders sell after expiry, now tracked on Zerodha's Kite platform.

articles.title: Budget 2026: ICAI seeks review of personal tax surcharge limits and deductions
articles.summary: ICAI urges Union Budget reforms in individual taxation, advocating health insurance deductions, higher surcharge thresholds, disability relief, and optional joint taxation for married couples.

articles.title: What’s new in NPS Vatsalya: PFRDA issues investment and withdrawal guidelines
articles.summary: PFRDA issues NPS Vatsalya Scheme Guidelines 2025, defining rules for minors, withdrawals, investment limits, transition at age 18, and incentives for Anganwadi and ASHA workers to boost enrolment.

articles.title: EPFO to now accept transgender identity certificates for name and gender updates

articles.title: Policybazaar launches online home loan insurance: How it works and cuts premium costs
articles.summary: Home loan insurance is intended to cover outstanding loan amounts in the event of a borrower’s death.

articles.title: How to transfer overseas education fees on the same day
articles.summary: BookMyForex enables same-day international transfers for overseas education payments, reducing delays and penalties. Cashback up to ₹15000 offered for transactions above ₹3 lakh via digital platforms.

articles.title: SC asks provident fund body to review ₹15,000 EPF wage ceiling: What it means for salaried employees
articles.summary: Supreme Court directs Centre and EPFO to review the ₹15000 EPF wage ceiling, unchanged since 2014, impacting retirement savings for millions of salaried employees across India.

articles.title: IDFC First Bank cuts savings account rates by up to 200 bps on certain balance slabs
articles.summary: IDFC First Bank cuts savings account interest rates by up to 200 basis points across slabs, effective January 9, with peak rates now capped at 6.5% for balances above ₹10 lakh.

articles.title: Groww Mutual Fund launches small-cap equity scheme
articles.summary: The fund will be managed by Anupam Tiwari. The minimum investment is ₹500, with an exit load of 1% if redeemed within one year, and none thereafter.

articles.summary: BIS may soon mandate silver jewellery hallmarking nationwide, says Sanjay Garg. Over 23 lakh silver items are certified, ensuring purity and consumer trust as infrastructure expands.

articles.summary: The SoftBank vehicle had originally acquired 81 crore shares at an average cost of Rs 50.94 per share in the electric scooter and motorcycle maker, which is now trading in the Rs 39–40 range.

articles.summary: Myntra has introduced a zero-commission model for new homegrown D2C brands joining its "Myntra Rising Stars" programme.

articles.summary: Skydo supports collections in more than 32 currencies, allowing exporters to receive payments locally from international clients while settling funds quickly in India.

articles.title: Startup news and updates: Daily roundup (January 9, 2026)
articles.summary: YourStory presents the daily news roundup from the Indian startup ecosystem and beyond. Here’s the roundup for Friday, January 9, 2026.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu unveils Deep Tech Startup Policy with Rs 100 Cr push
articles.summary: The key goals of the policy include a 25% increase in annual patent filings by deep tech startups, training of over 10,000 students and professionals in deep tech skills.

articles.summary: This drop is not surprising, given that there is usually a slow start to funding in January, which was also seen in 2025.

articles.summary: The regulator penalized the airline for failing to use qualified simulators for pilot training at challenging Category C airports.

articles.title: India must build transparent, unbiased AI rooted in local data: PM Modi
articles.summary: Chairing a roundtable with Indian AI startups ahead of the India AI Impact Summit 2026, PM Modi suggested that the startups should work towards global leadership from this country, and noted that India can promote affordable and inclusive AI and frugal innovation globally.

articles.summary: State bets big on frontier computing, announcing deployment of a cutting-edge machine at IIIT-Dharwad as part of a broader push to build an advanced deeptech ecosystem and attract next-generation research and talent.

articles.title: PhonePe launches 'PG Bolt' for one-click payments amid IPO push
articles.summary: PhonePe has introduced 'PhonePe PG Bolt', a 6-second checkout solution for Visa and Mastercard users. By utilising device tokenisation, it eliminates repetitive CVV entries and redirects.

articles.summary: In this photo essay, we showcase scenes from the popular Chitra Santhe art fair in Bengaluru.

articles.summary: Eternal, formerly known as Zomato, has received consecutive tax orders from West Bengal authorities demanding a total of approximately Rs 31.25 crore, inclusive of interest and penalties.

articles.title: Beyond AI hype: Why data is the real competitive moat
articles.summary: In an exclusive conversation, leaders discuss why data - not AI alone - is becoming the true differentiator for serving underserved customers, building resilient healthcare systems, and scaling startups in 2026.

articles.title: India, Nvidia discuss sovereign GPU development, local manufacturing
articles.summary: Nvidia dominates the global GPU market with more than an 80% share, and its chips have seen soaring demand worldwide as companies and governments scale up investments in artificial intelligence infrastructure.

articles.title: ONGC brings Mori-5 well under control within five days after blowout
articles.summary: State-owned explorer says rapid response after blowout during workover ranks among its fastest containment efforts.

articles.title: Govt weighs extending presumptive tax regime to renewable energy sector
articles.summary: This move aims to attract foreign expertise for setting up solar plants and participating in the value chain. The government is evaluating revenue implications before a final decision, aligning with its clean energy expansion goals.

articles.title: Renewable energy usage norms may be eased for energy derived from waste
articles.summary: According to draft procedures for RCO compliance mechanism, issued by the Bureau of Energy Efficiency, the exemption covers self-consumed electricity generated through waste recovery, including from byproduct gases, or other forms of residual energy sources associated with industrial processes

articles.title: PIB clears ₹26,000-crore Kamala Hydel Project in Arunachal
articles.summary: This advancement is set to enhance flood control and provide free energy to the residents of Arunachal Pradesh. Moreover, an additional ₹3,000 crore has been earmarked for establishing state-of-the-art power equipment testing facilities.

articles.title: New tariff threat more of a pressure tactic: Oil industry
articles.summary: Indian oil executives perceive this as a tactical pressure play in ongoing trade negotiations rather than a serious ultimatum. The intention appears to be to coerce India while nudging Russia towards a more peaceful resolution.

articles.title: US' solar alliance pull-out throws spanner in works for ties with India
articles.summary: The US departure is part of a broader policy shift. The International Solar Alliance was launched by India and France. It works to promote solar energy in developing nations. The US joined the alliance in 2021.

articles.title: Torrent Power bets ₹1 lakh crore on energy, builds new B2C platforms: Jinal Mehta, vice-chairman and MD
articles.summary: Torrent Power operates across the entire power value chain-coal-based and gas-based generation, renewables, transmission and distribution. We are also expanding into energy storage and green hydrogen. Importantly, every segment of the value chain is seeing growth today, giving us multiple growth engines and a balanced portfolio, says Jinal Mehta.

articles.title: Reliance Industries will consider buying Venezuelan oil
articles.summary: The company awaits clarity on whether non-US buyers will be permitted to acquire the crude. Reliance previously halted Venezuelan oil purchases in March 2026.

Delhi CM Rekha Gupta inaugurates the 47th National Junior Boys Handball Championship
Kashmiri man detained at Ram Mandir: 'Attempted' to offer namaz; family claims mental illness
articles.summary: A 55-year-old man from Jammu and Kashmir was detained in Ayodhya after allegedly attempting to offer namaz inside the Ram Mandir complex. Security personnel intervened, and the man was handed over to police. His family claims he is mentally ill and has a history of leaving home without notice. Investigations are ongoing to determine his intent.

articles.title: 'Sanjha Shakti': Indian Army conducts exercise to boost civil–military coordination in Southern Command
articles.summary: The Indian Army recently conducted 'Exercise Sanjha Shakti,' a joint military-civil fusion drill at Dighi Hills Range. Over 350 personnel from the Army and 16 civilian agencies, including police and fire departments, participated. The exercise aimed to bolster coordination for complex security challenges and emergency response, enhancing civil-military synergy for public safety and disaster management.

articles.title: ‘Thousand years since first attack’: PM Modi at Somnath ‘swabiman parv’; shares pictures
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi commenced a three-day visit to Gujarat, beginning in Somnath to participate in the Somnath Swabhiman Parv. His itinerary includes attending the Vibrant Gujarat Regional Conference and holding talks with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz. The visit also features a drone show, a ceremonial procession, and the inauguration of several development projects.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Punjab, Telangana flag higher fiscal burden under VB-G RAM G; seek more central funds

articles.summary: Exporters are receiving a significant boost with Rs 3,361.83 crore sanctioned under the Rs 20,000-crore Credit Guarantee Scheme for Exporters within its first month. This initiative aims to support businesses facing global trade headwinds, offering substantial credit guarantees to eligible exporters, including MSMEs, to enhance their competitiveness.

articles.title: Techno Paints plans to raise Rs 500 crore via IPO in FY27

articles.summary: US banks are raising concerns over President Trump's proposed 10% cap on credit card interest rates, warning it could limit credit access and harm consumers and small businesses. Industry groups argue such a move would be devastating and push users towards riskier alternatives, despite shared goals of affordability.

articles.title: Indian Railways timetable 2026: 549 trains sped up, 122 new added; what TAG 2026 means for passengers
articles.summary: Indian Railways introduces a major timetable change, TAG 2026. This plan adds 122 new trains and speeds up 549 existing services across the country. The goal is to reduce travel times and improve punctuality. New Vande Bharat and Amrit Bharat trains are part of this expansion.

articles.title: Service charge row: CCPA cracks down on 27 restaurants for mandatory levy; refunds, penalties ordered
articles.summary: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has taken action against 27 restaurants nationwide for mandatorily levying service charges, deeming it a violation of consumer law. Fines up to Rs 50,000 were imposed, with directions to refund collected charges and modify billing systems to prevent default additions.

articles.title: Oil Not Well: Why ExxonMobil thinks Venezuela is 'uninvestable'
articles.summary: This collapse is central to the scepticism voiced by oil companies. Restoring production on a meaningful scale is not a matter of restarting wells. It would require rebuilding pipelines, upgraders, refineries, power supply and skilled manpower, all of which demand long-term capital commitments.

articles.title: EU–Mercosur trade deal row: Why are Irish farmers protesting against the pact; what’s at stake

articles.title: Trade talks: India, EU push officials to fast-track FTA negotiations; here's what commerce ministry said
articles.summary: India and the European Union are pushing to finalize their free trade agreement. Officials met in Brussels to review progress and resolve outstanding issues. Both sides have expressed strong political will to conclude the negotiations soon.

articles.title: India-EU FTA: Piyush Goyal wraps up Brussels visit; talks focused on expediting agreement
articles.summary: India and the European Union advanced their Free Trade Agreement discussions during Minister Piyush Goyal's Brussels visit. Both sides committed to resolving outstanding issues to expedite a balanced agreement protecting farmers and MSMEs while integrating Indian industries into global supply chains. Goyal also visited Liechtenstein to discuss the India-EFTA TEPA, encouraging investment and collaboration.

articles.summary: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri highlighted that the government's long-term energy planning is translating into tangible benefits for citizens, stating that the real test of policy lies in how seamlessly it supports daily life rather than in announcements alone.

articles.title: ‘If you want to go in…’: Oil chiefs express caution as Trump pushes oil plan — what happened at the meeting
articles.summary: President Trump met with oil executives to discuss investments in Venezuela's oil sector following President Maduro's capture, presenting the country as secure for business. Industry leaders expressed caution, with one stating Venezuela is currently "uninvestable" without significant reforms. The US administration plans to manage company access to Venezuela's oil resources, sidelining Caracas from negotiations.

articles.title: GM hit with $6 billion in charges as EV incentives cut and emissions standards fade
Viral Smoking Girl: What we know (and don't know) about Khamenei protester breaking the internet
articles.summary: A woman, her hair uncovered, ignites a cigarette using a burning photo of Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. This defiant act, defying multiple Islamic Republic taboos, has gone viral, sparking debate about resistance to state-imposed norms. The video's origin and the woman's identity remain unconfirmed, yet it powerfully symbolizes ongoing protests against repression.

articles.title: Four killed in mine accident in northern Afghanistan
articles.summary: on Saturday. "The incident occurred in Khash District of Badakhshan province where four workers at a mine died", Ehsanullah Kamgar, the spokesman for Badakhshan's police told AFP, adding the deaths occurred on Friday.
